snippet.title: Coast jockey gets awarded top title
snippet.content: HORSE RACING: As Beerwah jockey Tiffani Brooker approaches the end of her apprenticeship, she does so with a coveted title and record to her name. The 24-year-old has had a stellar 2016-17 season in the saddle, placing in the top three at more than 140 meets. The solid effort resulted in Brooker winning the Queensland apprentice title. In her journey to becoming the best Queensland metropolitan apprentice jockey, Brooker also claimed a slice of history by becoming the first female apprentice jockey to ride 50 metropolitan winners in a season. The premiership-winning jockey, who is based at Corbould Park working for trainer Stuart Kendrick, still has six months left on her apprenticeship. Despite her recent success, she said a second tilt at the title was unlikely. Brooker hoped life after the apprenticeship would lead to riding in the professional ranks of the sport. "My goal is to just out-ride my claim and see how the next six months goes," she said. "So, it's just to keep improving and if I come out of my time and become a senior and still mix it in town obviously I'll really enjoy that. Then, perhaps in the future if it takes me somewhere else around Australia or overseas that's a bonus." At Corbould Park, Stuart Kendrick finished the season strong to be crowned the Sunshine Coast Turf Club's leading trainer, while Jeff Lloyd stormed home to be named the top jockey.
